Detailed Description

Functions for data transmission and reception.

Date:
2007-Dez-4
Author:
S.Radtke (C) 2007 Nanotron Technologies
Note:
BuildNumber = "BuildNumber : 7951";

This module contains all functions to operate the nanoLOC chip.

Definition at line 31 of file phy.c.

#define SendCfgUp   (*phySendMsgUp)

Callback function of upper layer.

This function is called when the physical layer wants to send configuration data to the next upper layer. This define is used to be able to add another layer.

void NTRXInterrupt ( void   ) 

interrupt service routine for the nanoLOC chip

This function is an interrupt service routine of the nanochip. It updates the TX and RX status flags.

void PDCallback ( void   ) 

Callback function for received messages.

This function reads out the payload of a received message and calls the upper layer/application

Definition at line 1072 of file phy.c.

void PDSap ( MsgT *  msg  ) 

This function processes all data request.

Parameters:
*msg this is the message pointer
This function represents the service access point for data requests and ranging requests. When the primitive is set to PD_DATA_REQUEST all necessary actions are taken to copy the payload to the nanoLOC chip and set the MAC header parameter in the corresponding registers. When all this is done the transmission will be initiated. In case of a transmission in progress, PDSap will reject the message and indicate a failure with the status PHY_BUSY_TX.

Definition at line 414 of file phy.c.

void PHYInit ( void   ) 

Initializing of module global variables.

This function initializes all module global variables located in the physical layers parameter information base (phyPIB). The nanoLOC chip has to be already initialized and in ready (idle) mode. The receiver is started and interrupts for CRC2 and Tx End and Rx End are enabled.

Definition at line 194 of file phy.c.

bool_t PHYIsIDLE ( void   ) 

Returns status of PHY and RANGING.

Returns:
TRUE if phy and ranging in status IDLE. Used to check the status of the driver before going power down.

Definition at line 1484 of file phy.c.

void PHYPoll ( void   ) 

polls the nanoLOC chip for incomming messages

This function is the main part of the the physical layer. It processes all interrupt flags and supervises the periodic recalibration.

Definition at line 1203 of file phy.c.

void PHYRegisterCallback ( callbackfn_t  cbMsg  ) 

Configuration of callback functions.

Parameters:
cbMsg Callback function pointer for the (protocol) message interface. If not set the PHY will call the function APLCallback by default.

Definition at line 1466 of file phy.c.

void PLMESap ( MsgT *  msg  ) 

Physical layer management entety.

Parameters:
*msg this is the the message struct
This function represents the service access point to configure the physical layer. All configuration parameters are stored in the physical layer parameter information base phyPIB. This function hides all necessarey steps to enable or disable certain features. With this function it is possible to set values but also to query the following settings:

PHY_CURRENT_CHANNEL : the channel is a transmission mode defined in PHY_TRX_MODE PHY_TRX_MODE : a set of three parameters bandwidth, symbol duration and symbol rate PHY_LOG_CHANNEL : is a predefined group of chip settings PHY_TX_POWER : output power setting [ 0 - 63 ] PHY_ARQ : hardware acknowledgement PHY_FEC : forward error correction PHY_MAC_ADDRESS1 : 1st MAC address for address matching PHY_MAC_ADDRESS2 : 2nd MAC address for address matching PHY_TX_ADDR_SELECT : select the MAC address as sender address PHY_ADDR_MATCHING : address matching or promiscuous mode PHY_PWR_DOWN_MODE : set operational mode PHY_RECALIBRATION : recalibration interval PHY_FRAME_TYPE : set frame types that will be handled by the nanoLOC chip

Definition at line 521 of file phy.c.

void TestmodeOff ( void   ) 

Helper function to switch off test modes.

This function switches off a previously enabled test mode. Note: Only one test mode at a time can be enabled.
